orchestrator.goal: Integrate the local views from the players and the public information to produce a coherent PDDL domain and problem pair suitable for the FastDownwards planner that encodes the actions, their preconditions and effects, and one or more initial-to-goal scenarios described in the statements.

public_information: There are 13 named objects from object_0 to object_12.
The domain contains predicates such as hand, cats, texture, sneeze, spring, stupendous, collect, next, and vase.
Available high level actions are paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, and tightfisted.
Action paltry requires preconditions: hand X, cats Y, texture Z, vase X Y, next Y Z. Its effects include making next X Z true and making vase X Y false.
Action sip requires preconditions: hand X, cats Y, texture Z, next X Z, next Y Z. Its effects include making vase X Y true and making next X Z false.
Action clip requires preconditions: hand X, sneeze Y, texture Z, next Y Z, next X Z. Its effects include making vase X Y true and making next X Z false.
Action wretched requires preconditions: sneeze X, texture Y, texture Z, stupendous W, next X Y, collect Y W, collect Z W. Its effects include making next X Z true and making next X Y false.
Action memory requires preconditions: cats X, spring Y, spring Z, next X Y. Its effects include making next X Z true and making next X Y false.
Action tightfisted requires preconditions: hand X, sneeze Y, texture Z, next Y Z, vase X Y. Its effects include making next X Z true and making vase X Y false.
The two scenario statements provide two alternative sets of initial facts and two alternative goal sets for testing planning solutions.

local_view.system_prompt: You are player_A and act as an observer. Your role is to summarize the local facts you observe and to restate action preconditions and effects in a clear, machine friendly way. Do not emit a full PDDL domain or problem. Focus on accuracy and name resolution when referring to objects.
local_view.prompt: Your name is player_A. Use the public information about predicates and actions and your private observations to produce a concise local view. Describe the initial facts you know and for each action you can see provide its preconditions and effects as simple lists. Indicate any ambiguities or naming differences you detect.

local_view.system_prompt: You are player_B and act as an observer. Your role is to summarize the local facts you observe and to restate action preconditions and effects in a clear, machine friendly way. Do not emit a full PDDL domain or problem. Focus on accuracy and name resolution when referring to objects.
local_view.prompt: Your name is player_B. Use the public information about predicates and actions and your private observations to produce a concise local view. Describe the initial facts you know and for each action you can see provide its preconditions and effects as simple lists. Indicate any ambiguities or naming differences you detect.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator and an expert in multi-agent PDDL modeling. Your job is to integrate the local views and the public information into a single coherent PDDL domain and one or more PDDL problem files compatible with the FastDownwards planner. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep actions distinct when they come from distinct local perspectives. Resolve naming ambiguities and ensure predicates, types, and action signatures are consistent. Target FastDownwards compatibility in typing, predicate usage, initial state encoding, and goal specification.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. Combine the public information and the views from the two players to produce a complete PDDL domain and at least one PDDL problem file that encodes the available actions and models at least the scenario_A and scenario_B goals. Use the exact action semantics inferred from the public information. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. The final output should be ready for FastDownwards.
